a.title: New COVID-19 Update From Our Executive Director

div.a: New COVID-19 Update From Our Executive Director

div.h1: New COVID-19 Update From Our Executive Director

div.div: New COVID-19 Update From Our Executive Director

img.alt: This is the image for the news article titled New COVID-19 Update From Our Executive Director
img.p: On Monday April 20, 2020, Governor DeWine confirmed that all schools are to remain closed for the remainder of the 2019 - 2020 school year to help mitigate the spread of the COVID-19 virus.

Constellation Schools extended closure education model will continue as designed with our teachers utilizing various platforms to connect regularly with your child. Their participation and completion of work throughout this period of distance learning is important as we seek to maintain the integrity of teaching and learning to the greatest extent possible during this unprecedented health emergency.

Please visit our website for updates pertaining to your child's school and to review available community resources that may be beneficial to you and your family. We encourage you to contact your building principal if you have any special needs that we may be able to assist you with.

We understand this news and subsequent ramifications are a tremendous disappointment for many of us. In the coming weeks your school will be finalizing and communicating what the next steps will be as we give our attention to ending the school year. This will include graduation/promotion ceremonies, the return of school materials, the collection of personal belongings and saying goodbye to our students. As we actively seek alternative solutions for events we recognize the importance of celebrating our students and their academic accomplishments. The special relationships between teachers and students in our schools has always stood out in our education environments.

Thank you for your continued patience and support as we work through these final weeks. We know our families have endured and sacrificed a great deal throughout this time. We appreciate all that you have done to support the education of your children while at home and our school community.
We wish continued good health and well-being to you and your family.

Sincerely,
Rebecca L. Keeney
Executive Director
Constellation Schools LLC

br.p:
To download a copy of this letter to families, please click the link below.
COVID-19 Letter to Families UPDATE 4.22.2020 (English)
COVID-19 Letter to Families UPDATE 4.22.2020 (Spanish)

div.p: Constellation Schools: Parma Community does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, disability, or age in its programs and activities and provides equal access to the Boy Scouts and other designated youth groups. The following person has been designated to handle inquiries regarding non-discrimination policies:
